content:
39. “... Let both grow together until the harvest; and at 
harvest time I will tell the reapers, Gather the weeds 
first and bind them in bundles to be burned, but gather 
the wheat into my barn.” This passage is on the parable 
of the 
A. mustard seed B. sower 
C. tares D. treasure hidden in a field. 
 
40. ‘Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for 
righteousness, for they shall ...’ 
A. inherit the earth B. be satisfied 
C.  obtain mercy D. see God. 
41. Jesus charged his disciples not to depart from Jerusalem 
but to wait for the promise of the Father. 
This promise was fulfilled when 
A. Jesus ascended into heaven. 
B. the Holy Spirit filled the disciples on the day 
of Pentecost. 
C. Jesus resurrected from the dead. 
D. the holy Spirit descended upon Cornelius and 
all who heard Peter’s preaching. 
 
42. On their return to Jerusalem immediately after the 
Ascension, the apostles devoted themselves to 
A. preaching B. healing C. alms-giving D. prayer. 
 
43. One of the main qualifications of the successor to Judas 
was that he should be a witness 
A. from the time of John the Baptist 
B. of the Ascension 
C. during the time of Christ’s ministry and death 
D. of the Resurrection. 
44. Peter explained that the disciples were not filled with new 
wine but with the Holy Spirit according to the prophecy 
of 
A. Joel B. Micah C. Isaiah D. Jonah 
 
45. Who advised the Sanhedrin to keep away from the 
apostles and let them alone? 
A. Cornelius B. Stephen C. Gamaliel D. James. 
 
46. Saul travelled to Damascus in order to 
A. obtain letters of authority from the High Priest 
B. be converted to Christianity  
C. be baptized by Ananias 
D. arrest those belonging to the Way. 
47. Peter was criticized by the circumcision party in 
Jerusalem because he 
A. converted the gentiles 
B. raised Dorcas to life 
C. ate with the gentiles 
D. baptized Cornelius 
48. Who prophesied a great famine over all the world at 
Antioch? 
A. Agabus B. Aeneas C. Claudius D. Barnabas. 
 
49. While Peter was still speaking this, the holy Spirit fell 
on all who heard the word. 
Where did this happen? 
A. Jerusalem B. Caesarea C. Antioch D. Damascus. 
 
50. Then they cast him out of the city and stoned him and 
the witnesses laid down their garments at the feet of 
young man named Saul. 
A. James B. Philip C. Barnabas D. Stephen 
 
  CHRISTIAN RELIGIOUS KNOWLEDGE 1988  
1. The reference in Genesis chapter 6 to the union between 
the ‘Sons of God’ and the ‘Daughters of Men’ explains 
the origin of 
A. hermaphrodites 
B. mighty men of renown 
C. gods and goddesses 
D. dwarfs. 
 
2. ‘Two nation’s in Rebekah’s womb refers to the 
A. Ammonites and Moabites 
B. Moabites and Edomites 
C. Edomites and Israelites 
D. Israelites and Ishmaelites. 
 
3. Joseph’s rough treatment of his brothers was to 
A. revenge on them 
B. prolong their starvation 
C. assure himself that they were not spies 
D. prove their sincere contrition 
 
4. Which of the following BEST describes Abraham’s 
reaction to God’s promise of a son by Sarah? 
A. Humility B. Optmism C. Generosity 
D. Faithlessness  
 
5. ‘Mahanaic is so called becaused Jacob saw the angles 
of God as God’s 
A. priests    B.  servants  C.  messengers D. army 
 
6. ‘I have sinned this time; the Lord is in the right, and I 
and my people are in the wrong; Pharaoh said this after 
the plague of the 
A. hailstorm B. death of the first born C. locusts 
D. darkness 
 
7. The request of Moses that Israel should be allowed to 
go and worship God was interpreted by Pharaoh to 
mean 
A. disobedience B. idleness C. lawlessness D. disloyalty 
 
8. The Passover lamb was to be kept until the fourteenth 
day of the first month when the whole assembly was to 
kill their lambs 
A. in the morning     B. at noon 
C. in the evening     D. at midnight. 
 
9. Pharaoh’s horsemen and his army overtook the fleeing 
Hebrews, encamped by the sea, at 
A. Migdol B. Etham C. Succoth D. Pihahiroth. 
 
10. The sin of the Israelites that led to the punishment by 
fiery serpents was 
A. making the golden calf 
B. speaking against God and Moses 
C. planning to return to Egypt 
D. trying to stone Caleb and Joshua.
